content.description: A certain spinner is divided into 6 sectors of equal size, and the spinner is equally likely to land in any sector. Four of the 6 sectors are shaded, and the remaining sectors are not shaded.
content.question: Which of the following is the best interpretation of the probability that one spin of the spinner will land in a shaded sector?

choices.label: For many spins, the long-run relative frequency with which the spinner will land in a shaded sector is <math alttext="one third" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>.

For many spins, the long-run relative frequency with which the spinner will land in a shaded sector is <math alttext="one half " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>.

For many spins, the long-run relative frequency with which the spinner will land in a shaded sector is <math alttext="two thirds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>.
For 6 spins, the spinner will land in a shaded sector 4 times.
For 6 spins, the spinner will land in a shaded sector 2 times.

content.answer: For many spins, the long-run relative frequency with which the spinner will land in a shaded sector is <math alttext="two thirds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>.

unit.text: 4: Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
